intro: Matelea dasytricha, commonly known as the Mexican candlewood, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other flowering plants with showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its large, clustered inflorescences of white to pink flowers that bloom in the summer. Its leaves are opposite and ovate, often with a hairy texture. Matelea dasytricha is typically found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
